stories.text:
Hey guys,

I drive to work a lot, spending on average of 2 hours each day. So I have plenty of time to listen to Podcast and audiobook on my ride. And I think it would be nice to be able to do the same with my reading list, but I couldn't find any decent app on the market that doing this. So I set out to do it myself.

Sooo this is the product: http://sendtopod.com/

You may ask why?

The reasons are simple:

- It's more convenient to listen to articles while you driving, running, or even before going to bed. - Listen take less effort than reading. - Your eyes need to rest after staring at screens all day. - Podcast app is a great tools for listening to audio content with support for: - CarPlay, Android Auto support built-in - Smart queuing - Offline listening

I see that https://hq.getmatter.app/ did a great job of read later app, it also have an OK text to speech audio, but does not have a podcast feed I can subscribe to.

I also see AudioRead.com do this but text to speech is IMHO not pleasant enough to listen to for a long time.

I'm running beta for this, would love to hear your feedback on ... anything really.

Thanks you all!
stories.title: Show HN: Bookmark an article, listen to it later on your own podcast feed
